oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Annual Report for Nineteen Hundred Fifty Seven, Third National Bank, Nashville, Tennessee, 1957
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The cover of a multi-page annual report for the Third National Bank in Nashville, Tennessee. This report covers thirty years, from 1927 through 1957. The artwork on the cover was painted by Nashville artist John Furlow and originally used for a billboard. The billboard was the first of its type to be seen in the Central South. Together the image and type promoted an image of friendly service. The bank was located at Fourth Avenue and Church Street in Nashville, Tennessee. Forms part of the Banks Ephemera Subject Files. 1 pamphlet : col. ; 8.5 x 11 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Third National Bank (Nashville, Tenn.)
